texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If odd bounced e-mails are coming back to the server or the server is listed in a blacklist, some accounts may be compromised on the server. Here's how to diagnose the issue:
texts.text: If odd bounced e-mails are coming back to the server or the server is listed in a blacklist, some accounts may be compromised on the server. Here's how to diagnose the issue:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Read the queue and look for messages with funky senders or lots of recipients.
texts.text: Read the queue and look for messages with funky senders or lots of recipients.

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
10 Feb 2007 07:31:08 GMT  #476884  10716  <service@paypal.com>
        remote  debbarger@earthlink.net
        remote  debbiabbis@hotmail.com
        remote  debbiak@aol.com
        *** lots more recicpients below ***
texts.text:
10 Feb 2007 07:31:08 GMT  #476884  10716  <service@paypal.com>
        remote  debbarger@earthlink.net
        remote  debbiabbis@hotmail.com
        remote  debbiak@aol.com
        *** lots more recicpients below ***

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This is a phishing e-mail being sent out to imitate PayPal. Now you need to find which IP is sending this e-mail, so grab the message ID and pass it to qmHandle:
texts.text: This is a phishing e-mail being sent out to imitate PayPal. Now you need to find which IP is sending this e-mail, so grab the message ID and pass it to qmHandle:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# qmHandle -m476884 | less
Received: (qmail 20390 invoked from network); 10 Feb 2007 07:31:08 -0600
Received: from unknown (HELO User) (207.219.92.194)
texts.text:
# qmHandle -m476884 | less
Received: (qmail 20390 invoked from network); 10 Feb 2007 07:31:08 -0600
Received: from unknown (HELO User) (207.219.92.194)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In this case, the offender is from 207.219.92.194. Now we can dig for the login in /var/log/messages:
texts.text: In this case, the offender is from 207.219.92.194. Now we can dig for the login in /var/log/messages:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# grep -i 207.219.92.194 /var/log/messages
Feb 10 10:19:33 s60418 smtp_auth: SMTP connect from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]
Feb 10 10:19:33 s60418 smtp_auth: smtp_auth: SMTP user [USER] : /var/qmail/mailnames/[DOMAIN]/[USER] logged in from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]
texts.text:
# grep -i 207.219.92.194 /var/log/messages
Feb 10 10:19:33 s60418 smtp_auth: SMTP connect from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]
Feb 10 10:19:33 s60418 smtp_auth: smtp_auth: SMTP user [USER] : /var/qmail/mailnames/[DOMAIN]/[USER] logged in from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Just for giggles, let's find out what their password is:
texts.text: Just for giggles, let's find out what their password is:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# mysql -u admin -p`cat /etc/psa/.psa.shadow`
mysql> use psa;
mysql> select CONCAT(mail_name,"@",name) as email_address,accounts.password
from mail left join domains on domains.id=mail.dom_id left join accounts on
accounts.id=mail.account_id where mail_name like '[USER]';
+---------------------------+----------+
| email_address             | password |
+---------------------------+----------+
| [USER]@[DOMAIN]           | password |
+---------------------------+----------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
texts.text:
# mysql -u admin -p`cat /etc/psa/.psa.shadow`
mysql> use psa;
mysql> select CONCAT(mail_name,"@",name) as email_address,accounts.password
from mail left join domains on domains.id=mail.dom_id left join accounts on
accounts.id=mail.account_id where mail_name like '[USER]';
+---------------------------+----------+
| email_address             | password |
+---------------------------+----------+
| [USER]@[DOMAIN]           | password |
+---------------------------+----------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Well, 'password' isn't a great password. Log into Plesk and change this password ASAP. To verify your work, tail /var/log/messages and you should see this:
texts.text: Well, 'password' isn't a great password. Log into Plesk and change this password ASAP. To verify your work, tail /var/log/messages and you should see this:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# tail -f /var/log/messages
Feb 10 10:27:08 s60418 smtp_auth: SMTP connect from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]
Feb 10 10:27:08 s60418 smtp_auth: smtp_auth: FAILED: [USER] - password incorrect  from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]
texts.text:
# tail -f /var/log/messages
Feb 10 10:27:08 s60418 smtp_auth: SMTP connect from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]
Feb 10 10:27:08 s60418 smtp_auth: smtp_auth: FAILED: [USER] - password incorrect  from unknown@ [207.219.92.194]

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Big thanks goes to Jon B. and Mike J. for this.
texts.text: Big thanks goes to Jon B. and Mike J. for this.
